results.title: They can do it
results.creator_credit: Education Development Centre, Allan Leitman and Lore Rasmussen
results.brief_description: Traces the development of an infant teacher’s approach to a class over a period of eight months at Pastorious Public School, Philadelphia. Initial traditional methods gain little response from her negro and underprivileged students. On introduction of a more relaxed and individual teaching program, the children become more involved with their surroundings and teacher.

results.title: They can be saved
results.creator_credit: Queensland. Dept. of Education and Greg Parry
results.brief_description: An interview on location which looks at the work of the Queensland Beach Protection Authority. Discusses the causes of beach erosion and the ways of preventing future destruction.

results.title: They came to Wales
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey, James Ritchie and Barry Clayton
results.brief_description: This kaleidoscopic film shows the new industrial Wales of nuclear power and electronics, of jet aircraft and optical glass developing in the older Wales of mountain, seascape and good company. We meet people who came to Wales from abroad and have found a new industrial and social life there.

results.title: They called me stupid (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Tom Kelly
results.brief_description: Focuses on the problems of dyslexia, a condition which causes great distress to children and adults, since it results in difficulties in reading and consequently also in learning. One theory is that it is a listening rather than a seeing complaint. Examines a new invention, called the “Electronic ear” which has proved helpful in many cases.

results.title: They called it 'fire proof'
results.brief_description: It was considered a fireproof hospital, yet fire did break out. The building was modern in construction; reasonable safety precautions were observed; but all this proved insufficient. The film argues the case for safety-consciousness and constant vigilance by the entire staff of any institutional building.

results.title: They appreciate you more
results.brief_description: Aliette lives in Montreal with her husband and three children. Since both Aliette and Pierre work outside their home full-time, they share household responsibilities. This development has changed them as individuals and, they think, has affected the dynamics of their family - for the better. This film is interesting for mixed audiences of women and men.

results.title: They all can work
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker and Brian Pollard
results.brief_description: Natural Recovery Systems of Moncton, New Brunswick, is a recycling factory. The employees are efficient and conscientious. All are eligible for on-the-job training and an after-hours life-skills program. They are mentally and physically disabled, a resource of forgotten people. The film shows them on and off the job, learning new skills, and generally relaxing among themselves in the company cafeteria. Narrated by Joseph Rutten. (Award: New York.)

results.title: These were the days: Victoria revisited
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Film Productions and David Morgan
results.brief_description: Takes the audience around Victoria to see the preserving of history in country towns. The port of Echuca where the paddle streamer Canberra runs up the Murray River; Sovereign Hill in Ballarat; Burke Museum at Beechworth; The Museum of Agricultural Machinery at Warracknabeal; The Gippsland Folk Museum at Moe; Coal Creek mining town at Korumburra and the Pioneer Settlement.

results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Eric Thompson and Jack Rogers
